posts.post_content: I made an aggressive white artifact deck, and the only card I've been more excited to draw than this is [Stoneforge Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stoneforge Mystic). Posted By: SleetFox (5/17/2011 1:54:46 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This guy is 1st-pick material, all the way. He doesn't commit you to a color, goes in absolutely any deck, and helps with the aggro plan that is ideal in this format. I had expected his one-toughness to be an issue that would drop his value a little; notsomuch. Yeah, [Pith Driller](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pith Driller ) will kill him, and [Arc Trail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Trail), and [Blisterstick Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blisterstick Shaman), and even [Instill Infection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Instill Infection), but the fact is that your opponent won't always have those answers. And when they don't, this guy *destroys.*
posts.html:
This guy is 1st-pick material, all the way. He doesn't commit you to a color, goes in absolutely any deck, and helps with the aggro plan that is ideal in this format. I had expected his one-toughness to be an issue that would drop his value a little; notsomuch. Yeah, Pith Driller will kill him, and Arc Trail, and Blisterstick Shaman, and even Instill Infection, but the fact is that your opponent won't always have those answers. And when they don't, this guy destroys.

posts.post_content: This thing is just amazing. Whether you use him as the defender role, or in an aggressive deck, there is little decks that he cant fit in. 2 life is hardly a drawback. 3 damage is a monster threat to get hit with early game, and first strike ensures that he can slay an elephant and live to tell about it.

posts.post_content: I play this in every aggresive deck I try in standard. It just fits wherever. It's the cheapest blocker to kill Mirran Crusader. It hits for 3 and hardly gets killed. Indeed in my illusions deck, sometimes he's the target to oblivion ring rather than my transformed [Insectile Aberration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Insectile Aberration). That makes me think "you're doing no wrong playing it"
